page.title: 10HISTORY OF THE RAF STATION
page.content: The station was opened in 1917 for several reasons; the favourable situation for defending the east coast of Scotland, the suitability of the surrounding terrain and the climte which gives, (apparenty),clearer skies!. The 3rd Statisical Account tells us that the camp grew considerably between the wars as farms and parts of Tentsmuir wre taken over. During the 2nd World War, it was important as a bomber and fighter station as well as a training centre. Luckily it escaped any bombing and by the early 1950's the proximity of the station had helped to make shopkeepers and tradesmen in the village more prosperous. Much of the communities entertainment and social life is closely connected with the camp functions.
